events.description: The Reserve Bank of India kept its key repo rate unchanged at 5.25%.

facts.fact_text: The Indian rupee rose to around 90.2 per dollar.

evidences.evidence_text: The Indian rupee rose to around 90.2 per dollar

facts.fact_text: The Reserve Bank of India kept its key repo rate unchanged at 5.25%.

evidences.evidence_text: The Reserve Bank of India kept its key repo rate unchanged at 5.25%, in line with expectations.

facts.fact_text: US-India trade deal reduces US tariffs on Indian imports from nearly 50% to 18%.

evidences.evidence_text: the US-India trade deal, which reduces US tariffs on Indian imports from nearly 50% to 18%, while protecting agricultural and key export sectors.

claims.claim_text: The hold reflects confidence in a softer inflation outlook and reassures markets that accommodative conditions will persist.

evidences.evidence_text: The hold reflects confidence in a softer inflation outlook and reassures markets that accommodative conditions will persist.

claims.claim_text: Near-term movements will continue to hinge on global risk sentiment, capital flows, and clarity around trade deal implementation, as well as the Budget session.
claims.author: analysts

evidences.evidence_text: Analysts note that near-term movements will continue to hinge on global risk sentiment, capital flows, and clarity around trade deal implementation, as well as the Budget session.

evidence.evidence_text: The Reserve Bank of India kept its key repo rate unchanged at 5.25%, in line with expectations.
The hold reflects confidence in a softer inflation outlook
the US-India trade deal, which reduces US tariffs on Indian imports from nearly 50% to 18%, while protecting agricultural and key export sectors.
reassures markets that accommodative conditions will persist.
